name: Media Tracker
description: An app I designed and made as part of my A Level Computer Science course. Users are able to create an account, search for and log a title into different lists (Completed, Planning, etc) and add their rating. I used Python Tkinter for the front-end and SQL for the database on the back-end.

name: Art Quiz
description: This is the first project I worked on during my course at La Fosse Academy. This app was designed to motivate students to enjoy non STEM subjects. Users are given a set of zoomed in paintings in which they must select the artist of. After a wrong guess, more of the painting is revealed. I worked on the front-end with JavaScript.

name: Florinate
description: In this group project, we built an app to help enhance a fictional community called 'Florin'. I worked on both the front and back-end, as well as testing the front-end, with JS, NodeJS and Jest. Users are able to create an account, create and apply to job listings, create and bookmark events and, finally, create and join skill classes.

name: Pokrastemon
description: This app uses the well-loved franchise Pok√©mon and study technique 'pomodoro' to help motivate users, with a focus on students, to study. I worked on the both the front and back-end of this project, using NodeJs and React.

name: Sight Reader
description: In my final project at La Fosse, my team and I built a web app designed to help users practise their sight-reading skills. Users are able to make/complete assignments, message friends and as earn points to appear on a leader-board. I worked on the API routes and database on the back-end and the account page on the front-end.

name: Hangman
description: A simple hangman game I built using JS and HTML. I used an external API to generate random words.

name: Theatre App
description: An unfinished webpage for an imaginary theatre to showcase their shows and screenings. I worked on this in a pair with a fellow student at La Fosse Academy.
